remarks: Any ring with an absolute value is a domain, which is to say that it contains no zero divisors.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2014.)
statement:
abv0.a $e |- A = ( AbsVal ` R ) $.
abvneg.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
abvrec.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
abvdom.t $e |- .x. = ( .r ` R ) $.
abvdom $p |- ( ( F e. A /\ ( X e. B /\ X =/= .0. ) /\ ( Y e. B /\ Y =/= .0. ) ) -> ( X .x. Y ) =/= .0. ) $.
